00001 // CLASSIFICATION: UNCLASSIFIED
00002 #ifndef CoordinateConversionService_H

00004 
00005 /***************************************************************************/
00006 /* RSC IDENTIFIER: Coordinate Conversion Service
00007  *
00008  * ABSTRACT
00009  *
00010  *    This component is the coordinate conversion service for the MSPCCS
00011  *    application.  It provides an external input interface that supports the
00012  *    MSPCCS GUI (Java) and the MSPCCS file processing
00013  *    component.
00014  *
00015  *    This component depends on the DT&CC modules:  DATUM, ELLIPSOID,
00016  *    GEOCENTRIC, GEOREF, MERCATOR, TRANSVERSE MERCATOR, UTM, MGRS, USNG, POLAR
00017  *    STEREOGRAPHIC, UPS, LAMBERT_1, LAMBERT_2, ALBERS, AZIMUTHAL EQUIDISTANT, BONNE,
00018  *    BRITISH NATIONAL GRID,  CASSINI, CYLINDRICAL EQUAL AREA,ECKERT4, ECKERT6,
00019  *    EQUIDISTANT CYLINDRICAL, GARS, GNOMONIC, LOCAL CARTESIAN, MILLER, MOLLWEIDE,
00020  *    NEYS, NEW ZEALAND MAP GRID, OBLIQUE MERCATOR, ORTHOGRAPHIC, POLYCONIC,
00021  *    SINUSOIDAL, STEREOGRAPHIC, TRANSVERSE CYLINDRICAL EQUAL AREA, and VAN DER GRINTEN.
00022  *
00023  *
00024  * ERROR HANDLING
00025  *
00026  *    This component checks for error codes returned by the DT&CC modules.
00027  *    If an error code is returned, it is combined with the current
00028  *    error code using the bitwise or.  This combining allows multiple error
00029  *    codes to be returned. The possible error codes are listed below.
00030  *
00031  *
00032  * REUSE NOTES
00033  *
00034  *    Coordinate Conversion Service is intended for reuse by other applications that require
00035  *    coordinate conversions between multiple coordinate systems and/or datum
00036  *    transformations between multiple datums.
00037  *
00038  *
00039  * REFERENCES
00040  *
00041  *    Further information on Coordinate Conversion Service can be found in the Coordinate
00042  *    Conversion Service Reuse Manual.
00043  *
00044  *    Coordinate Conversion Service originated from : U.S. Army Topographic Engineering Center
00045  *                             Digital Concepts & Analysis Center
00046  *                                       7701 Telegraph Road
00047  *                                       Alexandria, VA  22310-3864
00048  *
00049  *
00050  * LICENSES
00051  *
00052  *    None apply to this component.
00053  *
00054  * RESTRICTIONS
00055  *
00056  *    Coordinate Conversion Service has no restrictions.
00057  *
00058  * ENVIRONMENT
00059  *
00060  *    Coordinate Conversion Service was tested and certified in the following environments:
00061  *
00062  *    1. Solaris 2.5 with GCC, version 2.8.1
00063  *    2. Windows XP with MS Visual C++, version 6
00064  *
00065  * MODIFICATIONS
00066  *
00067  *    Date              Description
00068  *    ----              -----------
00069  *    04-22-97          Original Code
00070  *    09-30-99          Added support for 15 new projections
00071  *    05-30-00          Added support for 2 new projections
00072  *    06-30-00          Added support for 1 new projection
00073  *    09-30-00          Added support for 4 new projections
00074  *    03-24-05          Added support for Lambert Conformal Conic (1 Standard Parallel)
00075  *    08-17-05          Changed Lambert_Conformal_Conic to Lambert_Conformal_Conic_2
00076  *    06-06-06          Added support for USNG
00077  *    07-17-06          Added support for GARS
00078  *    03-17-07          Original C++ Code
00079  *    07-20-10          NGL BAEts27152 Updated getServiceVersion to return an int
00080  */
00081

00145     const int COORD_SYS_CODE_LENGTH = 3;   /* Length of coordinate system codes (including null) */
00146     const int COORD_SYS_NAME_LENGTH = 50;  /* Max length of coordinate system names (including null) */

00148     const int DATUM_NAME_LENGTH = 33;      /* Max length of datum names (including null) */
00149     const int ELLIPSOID_CODE_LENGTH = 3;   /* Length of ellipsoid codes (including null) */
00150     const int ELLIPSOID_NAME_LENGTH = 30;  /* Max length of ellipsoid names (including null) */

00390       /* Coordinate Conversion Service State Definition */
00391       struct Coordinate_State_Row
00392       {
00393         char datumCode[DATUM_CODE_LENGTH];   /* currently specified datum code  */
00394         long datumIndex;                     /* currently specified datum index */
00395         CoordinateType::Enum coordinateType; /* current coordinate system type  */
00396         Parameters parameters;               /* current coordinate system parameters */
00397         CoordinateSystem* coordinateSystem;  /* current coordinate system */
00398       };

00401          c = Number of IO states (Source, Target, etc.) */

00487       /*
00488        *  The function convert converts the current input coordinates in the coordinate
00489        *  system defined by the current input coordinate system parameters and input datum,
00490        *  into output coordinates in the coordinate system defined by the output coordinate
00491        *  system parameters and output datum.
00492        *
00493        *  sourceDirection: Indicates which set of coordinates and parameters to use as the source (input)
00494        *  targetDirection: Indicates which set of coordinates and parameters to use as the target (input)
00495        */
00496 
00497       void convert( SourceOrTarget::Enum sourceDirection, SourceOrTarget::Enum targetDirection, CoordinateTuple* sourceCoordinates, Accuracy* sourceAccuracy, CoordinateTuple& targetCoordinates, Accuracy& targetAccuracy );

00506       /*
00507        *  The function convertCollection will convert a list of source coordinates to a list of target coordinates
00508        *  in a single step.
00509        *
00510        *  sourceCoordinatesCollection      : Coordinates of the source coordinate system to be converted   (input)
00511        *  sourceAccuracyCollection         : Source circular, linear and spherical errors                  (input)
00512        *  targetCoordinatesCollection      : Converted coordinates of the target coordinate system         (output)
00513        *  targetAccuracyCollection         : Target circular, linear and spherical errors                  (output)
00514        */
